form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: ROOM AND BOARD, Part 2 Extended Benefits

full_text: ROOM AND BOARD means: your room. meals and general nursing while you are an inpatient. Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 ROUTINE CHARGE means: the amount which Blue Shield determines to be the charge made for like services by physicians in the same community. SPECIAL SERVICES means: the services and supplies that a facility ordinarily furnishes to its patients for diagnosis or treatment during the time the patient is in the facility. Special Services include such things as: A. The use of special rooms, such as operating or treatment rooms. B. Tests and exams. C. The use of special equipment in the facility. D. Drugs: medications; solutions: biological preparations: and medical and surgical supplies used while you are in the facility. E. Administration of infusions and transfusions. (This does not include the cost of: whole blood: packed red blood cells: or blood donor fees). F. Artificial replacement of internal parts of the body which are part of an operation. This includes things such as hip aids. joints, skull plates and pacemakers. It does not include things such as: artificial limbs: or artificial eyes: or hearing SUBSCRIBER means: the person with whom Blue Cross and Blue Shield have entered into this contract. AND CUSTOMARY CHARGE means: the payment amount which we set for the services that are provided Schedule under this of contract. USUAL For those providers who have agreements with Blue Shield. Blue Shield sets it according to the Amended Benefits approved by the Commissioner of Insurance at the time you receive the providers' service. You have the right to the following benefits EXCEPT as excluded or limited elsewhere in this contract. These benefits subscribers are in Part 2 to those provided in Blue Cross subscribers certificate BCC 80 NG or BCC 250 NG and Blue Shield covered addition BSC 80 NG. Please notice that charts are used below. These charts highlight the benefits available to a person certificate this contract. DO NOT rely on these charts alone. They only summarize benefits. Be sure to read the explanations following Extended each by chart as well. They describe the benefits in more detail and contain some important restrictions. Benefits IMPORTANT: ALL THE BENEFITS DESCRIBED IN THIS CONTRACTARE SUBJECT TO A $100 CALENDAR YEAR DEDUCTIBLE FOR EACH MEMBER. This means you must pay the first $100 of allowed charges in each calendar year. Then. we provide benefits. ALL THE BENEFITS DESCRIBED IN THIS CONTRACT ARE SUBJECT TO A LIFETIME MAXIMUM OF $250,000 FOR EACH MEMBER. Once you have received $250,000 in benefits. no more benefits are available under this contract. See Part 3 Page 10 for further explanation of this maximum. Page 6 1. AS AN INPATIENT IN A PARTICIPATING GENERAL HOSPITAL: You have the right to benefits in a semiprivate room or intensive care unit as follows:
